raw_text: Wu (1997) and Alshawi et al (2000) showed statistical models based on syntactic structure. The way we handle syntactic parse trees is in spired by their work, although their approach is not to model the translation process, but to formalize a model that generates two languages at the same time

raw_text: Wu (1997) showed that restricting word-level alignments between sentence pairs to observe syntactic bracketing constraints significantly reduces the complexity of the alignment problem and allows a polynomial-time solution. Alshawi et al (2000) also induce parallel tree structures from unbracketed parallel text, modeling the generation of each node? s children with a finite-state transducer
clean_text: Wu (1997) showed that restricting word-level alignments between sentence pairs to observe syntactic bracketing constraints significantly reduces the complexity of the alignment problem and allows a polynomial-time solution. Alshawi et al (2000) also induce parallel tree structures from unbracketed parallel text, modeling the generation of each node's children with a finite-state transducer.
